3898F78403384CA2B3FDCD134938C969.description: Use relative frequencies calculated for rows or columns to describe possible association between the two variables

9CA88B8FB7C7419E90E2C06055F902C9.description: Construct and interpret a two-way table summarizing data on two categorical variables collected from the same subjects.

A9FEE6BF6E324352B8756D7786C3B2AD.description: Understand that patterns of association can also be seen in bivariate categorical data by displaying frequencies and relative frequencies in a two-way table

3CB08E25D80A4E579CC6325D66719959.description: Use the equation of a linear model to solve problems in the context of bivariate quantitative data, interpreting the slope and ï¿½-intercept

B5C48981C1BB440F93BFF728D40673D9.description: Informally assess the model fit by judging the closeness of the data points to the line

1300A855798D41CC921B62268BFE2348.description: Informally fit a straight line for a scatter plot that suggests a linear association

E2088BF496EB46D2AE5E342BBCD4C6E5.description: Model the relationship between bivariate quantitative data to:

34B0E8B54AFA470AA258CC1670CF7480.description: Construct and interpret scatter plots for bivariate measurement data to investigate patterns of association between two quantities. Investigate and describe patterns such as clustering, outliers, positive or negative association, linear association, and nonlinear association.

C749F268A5994B0FAC998E004B3A9A4D.description: Investigate patterns of association in bivariate data.

48C91CE8259C4E29828EB69203A6E394.description: Understand how the formulas for the volumes of cones, cylunders, and spheres are related and use the relationship to solve real-world and mathematical problems.

453109248541488681B55474A8939DD3.description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems involving volume of cylinders, cones, and spheres.

AF2F218668C240DAAE12D515143D9C82.description: Apply the Pythagorean Theorem to find the distance between two points in a coordinate system.

80E744F46DEB4A41B38C42A9A221B9D3.description: Apply the Pythagorean Theorem and its converse to solve real-world and mathematical problems.

E83892320D5C4CE5837A6B13594AC8C6.description: Explain the Pythagorean Theorem and its converse.

38F04D68A69F4A8FBAAEB62E6410C92C.description: Understand and apply the Pythagorean Theorem.

7626C0AF11DC419C9051134DEE7717EF.description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems involving angles.

53859E5A239642309B4014BDDBB68A55.description: Recognize the angle-angle criterion for similarity of triangles.

19FB40C9678344ADA453938EA7D001C8.description: Recognize the relationships between the angles created when parallel lines are cut by a transversal.

7BEB14EBA6394805B6FA6329C946B343.description: Recognize relationships between interior and exterior angles of a triangle.

0C93AE3927C644E69870CBED7581E0A5.description: Use informal arguments to analyze angle relationships.

D8F03C183D5E41EAA6D05E8D1C6B0F63.description: Given two similar two-dimensional figures, describe a sequence that exhibits the similarity between them

D03E6F0E29BB488C8A9E6F8629B8221E.description: Understand that a two-dimensional figure is similar to another if the second can be obtained from the first by a sequence of rotations, reflections, translations, and dilations.

26938BA1855F4F55948AABC1BCDFC059.description: Verify experimentally the properties of dilations that create similar figures.

EE1188AD8615446A9129C3AAF3B6E6C1.description: Describe the effect of dilations about the origin, translations, rotations about the origin in 90 degree increments, and reflections across the ï¿½-axis and ï¿½-axis on two-dimensional figures using coordinates.

0D930F808DAA45AC8FC2C63B109ADAE3.description: Given two congruent figures, describe a sequence that exhibits the congruence between them

9BEE917F31BC464698B1E97C3BF4DD64.description: Understand that a two-dimensional figure is congruent to another if the second can be obtained from the first by a sequence of rotations, reflections, and translations.

1305451C73C04BF5B46F257E9BE75A9E.description: Verify experimentally the properties of rotations, reflections, and translations that create congruent figures

A2724F0B9DB448B0AC7BD7DAE64356D5.description: Understand congruence and similarity using physical models, transparencies, or geometry software.

3BBC335C990D463A9EB7E07F8406EF8A.description: Sketch a graph that exhibits the qualitative features of a real-world function.

BDAE4AA30B4B4C4F83BEFDAEAC6BF006.description: Analyze a graph determining where the function is increasing or decreasing; linear or non-linear

427FD4879F0441E3905D2042B31D8247.description: Qualitatively analyze the functional relationship between two quantities.

AF422EE3F7544C988D38F868FD3CE48B.description: Interpret the rate of change and initial value of a linear function in terms of the situation it models, and in terms of the slope and y-intercept of its graph or a table of values.

869306CE9C4240FEA4D960CC88B46ED8.description: Construct a graph of a linear relationship given an equation in slope-intercept form

5B6889332D5E4EC19514FCD30E49EE6E.description: Write an equation in slope-intercept form to model a linear relationship by determining the rate of change and the initial value, given at least two (ï¿½, ï¿½) values or a graph

E1957E879BCB45349C33BEA5DD75970E.description: Understand that a linear relationship can be generalized by y = mx + b

E61F33FA95F047B2B4A95F9ED7AF48F9.description: Analyze functions that model linear relationships.

D93C1CC7F0814A92A1C83851FBF0834F.description: Use functions to model relationships between quantities.

6E5226CCDC754CF1AD8688FBDCFDD36A.description: Identify linear functions from tables, equations, and graphs.

A6F79C9791FB46AAB97C242DAE02150E.description: Compare properties of two linear functions each represented in a different way (algebraically, graphically, numerically in tables, or by verbal descriptions).

8A062A865E974F35BA9DC991CF107B7F.description: Recognize functions given a table of values or a set of ordered pairs.

51473250E0AB4C818B92D64B102C2ED9.description: Recognize functions when graphed as the set of ordered pairs consisting of an input and exactly one corresponding output.

B5A60667F6AF491884C22EBBFCDF30E5.description: Understand that a function is a rule that assigns to each input exactly one output.

44D55A738AED4B2DA9C9BA697D5A00B3.description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems leading to systems of linear equations by graphing the equations. Solve simple cases by inspection.

375B0B1E20F04787AC352044798BA379.description: Understand that solutions to a system of two linear equations correspond to the points of intersection of their graphs because the point of intersection satisfies both equations simultaneously.

BDA8A91B088B44988A27D0ABB4E14B20.description: Analyze and solve a system of two linear equations in two variables in slope-intercept form.

3F033C6ED6B344C49E7DE9E894BA80D3.description: Analyze and solve pairs of simultaneous linear equations.

EC8F72C739D946688FE557AC32F1FE28.description: Solve linear equations and inequalities including multi-step equations and inequalities with the same variable on both sides.

EA5F1E3B8D7749C0BD1A8369DC40852A.description: Recognize linear equations in one variable as having one solution, infinitely many solutions, or no solutions.

9A60379D0049424EA922075A22B6EB9E.description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems by writing and solving equations and inequalities in one variable.

A04E7950B9304E72AE37F62534A10D7E.description: Analyze and solve linear equations and inequalities

4FEA5CE1FA4F4A19B43649E3EC14F66C.description: Perform multiplication and division with numbers expressed in scientific notation to solve real-world problems, including problems where both decimal and scientific notation are used.

38138B5B974F4B65BBFE2CAED1ADED86.description: Use numbers expressed in scientific notation to estimate very large or very small quantities and to express how many times as much one is than the other.

8D2C409B0D4841CC8E9ED9C9B2973E94.description: Evaluate square roots of perfect squares and cube roots of perfect cubes for positive numbers less than or equal to 400.

A311BDAC4E1047CD8269302AF8A36970.description: Represent solutions to equations of the form x^2 = p and x^3 = p, where p is a positive rational number.

2B69B271A315438A89132107AD2A1B59.description: Use square root and cube root symbols to:

8BDB1497ED6A48ECBAAE50F572BFD777.description: Develop and apply the properties of integer exponents to generate equivalent numerical expressions.

B99D0076116944C0BCCCBA6862082117.description: Work with radicals and integer exponents

DB578C0E9920433B90F747F43D79F24B.description: Square roots and cube roots to the tenths.

B01C6F64D8AB43DFAA98558D1767468E.description: Use rational approximations of irrational numbers to compare the size of irrational numbers and locate them approximately on a number line. Estimate the value of expressions involving:

95D260BD4F02451C8E86937954D5C7B0.description: Understand that every number has a decimal expansion. Building upon the definition of a rational number, know that an irrational number is defined as a non-repeating, non-terminating decimal.

159D6C2246084DBD9471399D58444ADF.description: Know that there are numbers that are not rational, and approximate them by rational numbers.

C23EB68C5A224A46BA41319529070CB2.description: Look for and express regularity in repeated reasoning.

3474A100729E4EE0B2B4B8F80C14AFC7.description: Look for and make use of structure.

7A79C6FCFD844390BB11632EDFCD35E6.description: Construct viable arguments and critique the reasoning of others.

C28A3625DA164BFCA3D96AC59D0E108C.description: Make sense of problems and persevere in solving them.

F5918B020CEA4258A65507A5095758BB.description: NC Standards Course of Study - Math Grade 6 (2018)
